intro: Spelaeanthus, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture, adapted to arid and rocky environments. Spelaeanthus species are often found in mountainous regions, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Their flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
